medical_history.chief_complaint: Retinal dysfunction due to mutations in CACNA2D4.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Lifelong stable subnormal visual acuity (VA) of approximately 20/30, low color discrimination, and photophobia noted at ages 18 and 40. The first proband reported moderate myopic astigmatism and poor contrast perception.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of breast carcinoma treated with surgery, chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and tamoxifen in one patient. The other patient had no significant medical history.
medical_history.family_history: In the first proband, there were no similarly affected family members. In the second, 2 brothers and 2 sons had a red-green color defect, but no other affected family members were noted.
